edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.filtration

Class FiltrationConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.filtration.FiltrationConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.functional.ObjectObjectFunction<Interval<java.lang.Integer>,Interval<java.lang.Double>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExternalConverter, IdentityConverter, IncreasingLinearConverter, StaticConverter

    public abstract class FiltrationConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.functional.ObjectObjectFunction<Interval<java.lang.Integer>,Interval<java.lang.Double>>
    This interface defines a mapping between filtration values and filtration indices.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

        public abstract double getFiltrationValue(int filtrationIndex)
        This function computes the filtration value from a filtration index.
        Parameters:
        filtrationIndex - the index to convert
        Returns:
        the filtration value for the particular index

      • computeInducedFiltrationValue

        public abstract double computeInducedFiltrationValue(double filtrationValue1,
                                   double filtrationValue2)
        This function computes the filtration value that is consistent with the ordering of filtration indices. For example, for filtration values that are increasing with filtration indices, this should be the max function.
        Parameters:
        filtrationValue1 -
        filtrationValue2 -
        Returns:
        the filtration value that is induced by two filtration values

      • getInitialFiltrationValue

        public abstract double getInitialFiltrationValue()
        This function returns the filtration at index 0.
        Returns:
        the filtration at index 0
